pr_title: Fix remove attributes from span after termination

timeline.message: Fix remove attributes from span after termination

timeline.bodyText: Do you really need to add 5 attributes for this test? You could have a single item and assert that only that item remains afterwards, and make the test simpler/smaller.
timeline.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: Oh, never mind. You are exercising all the attribute types.
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: This will not be added anyway. Maybe we can keep only the values that will be really added? This makes the test more concise.
timeline.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: You're right! This is pointless since it is covered by another test!
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.bodyText: why don't we just do this check once up front, rather than repeating the code here and below?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I didn't want to introduce another synchronized block. But I guess you're right, it is better to do only once upfront!
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: I'd rather have one slightly larger synchronized block, rather than force jumping in and out of the synchronization twice in rapid succession. As long as you're doing very cheap operations, just putting all the logic in one synchronization context is going to be better.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: But this one does not jump between synchronized.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I agree. I was just thinking forward to moving the ended check up-front, rather then duplicating that check.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Splitting the lock is incorrect. You need to make the check in the same lock sync to ensure that the condition does not change between the two synchronized sections
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: To clarify @jkwatson your proposal is correct but your concern should not be a preference should be a requirement because otherwise the code is incorrect :)
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: You are right @bogdandrutu, I was thinking only to the case where the span already ended.
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: @bogdandrutu also true! I hadn't actually fully thought through the implementation, but you are absolutely correct.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Personally I am happy with the current code, but not opposed to change it based on @jkwatson suggestion. Up to you @thisthat :)
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I think having everything in a single synchronized block makes it easier to fully understand the method. 7cab1ee addresses this 😉
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.message: Remove attribute in the same synchronized block
